intro: Iberis pectinata var. bourgaei, commonly known as the Bourgai's candytuft, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and segmented stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring dense, mat-forming foliage with bright green, slightly hairy leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in early spring, range in color from white to pale yellow, adding ornamental value to gardens. This variety is valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
